fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33214].
  {panel}

In CONF-7612 we solved the issue of attachments in the Editor by no longer sending notifications for that event.

This ticket is to deal with the notification storms that can be generated by attachments being added to the view page through multiple scenarios including:

* Uploading many attachments at once
* Multiple small changes being made to a file and having it continually uploaded
* Updating a Gliffy Diagram

If you have other examples, please leave a comment.
fields.summary: Attaching files to the view page generates notification noise

fields.description:
1. Create a Confluence wiki page and make sure you are a watcher.
2. Add a table with a few columns (at least 3) and rows (same) and type some letters in the cells
3. Save
4. Edit page and modify the table cells content
5. Check the email received as a result of the page being modified.

The HTML in the email is wrong. The "table" has a variable number of columns, they are overlapped, complete nightmare. I don't know if this has been fixed in a newer version. We're currently using 5.1.4 in our company.

Thanks!
Costi
fields.summary: Incorrect HTML in the email sent when a table has been edited in a wiki page

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce
# Create a blog post and insert a code macro containing some text
# Create a page, use a blog post macro such that the blog would show up
# Export this page to PDF

h2. Expected behavior
All content, including the code snippet from the blog, would be part of the PDF

h2. Actual behavior
The PDF does not include the code snippet from the blog post

h2. Other notes/workarounds

# Exporting the blog itself to PDF works fine

fields.description:
Here are the steps to reproduce: 
# Create a page with image and text.
# Save the page and add 20 followers to watch the page. 
# Add or remove one image showing on the page. 
# Save the page. 
# the doeditpage.action was taking more than 2 seconds to finish the job.

* with single node with no extra permission settings and only one user connected, it took around 2 seconds to save the page. Here is the [Access log|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/114298/single_node.log].
* with a cluster of 2 nodes with no extra permission settings and only one user connected, it took around 5 seconds to save the page. Here is the [Access log|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/114297/cluster.log] 

When there is not watcher on the page, saving the page took less than 1 seconds.
fields.summary: Slowness when saving page after update the image on the page

fields.description:
We have the same error like described in this issue: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-31772

The problem seems to occur to one specific user. That user can't be LDAP synchronised, can't login and you cannot open the User Detail information or the Group Detail information that user belongs got. We always get following exception: 

org.springframework.dao.IncorrectResultSizeDataAccessException: query did not return a unique result: 2
        at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.SessionFactoryUtils.convertHibernateAccessException(SessionFactoryUtils.java:590)
        at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateAccessor.convertHibernateAccessException(HibernateAccessor.java:353)
        at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.execute(HibernateTemplate.java:375)
        at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.execute(HibernateTemplate.java:337)
        at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.hibernate2.HibernateUserDao.internalFindUser(HibernateUserDao.java:474)
        at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.hibernate2.HibernateUserDao.internalFindByName(HibernateUserDao.java:451)
        at com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.hibernate2.HibernateUserDao.findByName(HibernateUserDao.java:431)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.user.crowd.CachedCrowdUserDao$1.apply(CachedCrowdUserDao.java:76)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.user.crowd.CachedCrowdUserDao$1.apply(CachedCrowdUserDao.java:71)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.cache.option.OptionalReadThroughCache.get(OptionalReadThroughCache.java:33)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.user.crowd.CachedCrowdUserDao.findUser(CachedCrowdUserDao.java:136)
        at com.atlassian.confluence.user.crowd.CachedCrowdUserDao.findByName(CachedCrowdUserDao.java:158)
        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor263.invoke(Unknown Source)
        (...)

We are not able te remove the user from the system. When we exclude the user in den LDAP sync configuration, do a restart of the server, the user entry seems to disappear. But when we try to sync the user from LDAP again, the LDAP synchronisation fails with the above exception. 

How can we get rid off this "corrupted" user entry? Does that entry reside in the database or in a local cache file? How did this corrupted user entry even happen?

Or: it is possible there are much more such users in our productive system with full LDAP directory. How to recognize those?
fields.summary: Corrupted User(s) - LDAP-Sync fails
Include Office Connector Document in PDF Export
Remember opened branches in the page hierarchy

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33201].
  {panel}

Currently, if a user wants to reorder pages he has to go to "Configure Space > Sort pages" and then expand the page tree up to the point where he'd like to reorder a page. This is highly interruptive, because the current page the user was looking at previously is lost and he has to do the more clicks the deeper the page hierarchy is.

I could imagine two solutions:

- remember the currently watched page and automatically expand the page tree on the "sort pages" view up to this page
- allow re-ordering and moving of pages directly in the page hierarchy side bar (preferred)
fields.summary: Make page reordering more intuitive and less interruptive

fields.description:
Mac OS 10.9.2
Mozilla 28.0
Excel 14.3.9
URL https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/~gtotev/Scoring+models

How to reproduce:
1. Attach Excel spreadsheet to a newly created page
2. Add Office Excel Macro to the page, defining Sheet name, max row and max column to display. Save the page and verify the result - it works as expected.
3. Open the page for editing, select the Macro you created in step 2 and select Edit
4. Change either the columns or row (have not tested with the Sheet name). The macro preview does not update.
5. Save the macro.
6. Select either Save or Preview. The page does not reflect the updated rows or columns.
fields.summary: Office Excel Macro does not update after edit

The assigned task then shows up in the users personal task list.
However, when they update the task and mark it as complete, only the complete checkmark is propagated to the meeting notes actions, the comments that they enter for the task does not get copied on the page where the meeting notes are captured. 

How can i see the comments for the task show up on the meeting notes page?

fields.description: h3. Issue Summary Adding an image by using "data:image" as a web image will throw an error "com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlException: Missing required attribute: {http://atlassian.com/resource/identifier}value" h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create empty page # Open image macro # Click on "Images from the web" # Paste this block to it: {noformat} data:image/jpeg;base64, {noformat} # Click insert # Image will be visible in editor and in preview mode. # Save page h3. Expected Results Image is visible. h3. Actual Results Image is not visible, and on the place of the image we will get an error message: {code} com.atlassian.confluence.content.render.xhtml.XhtmlException: Missing required attribute: {http://atlassian.com/resource/identifier}value {code} h3. Workaround Use [HTML macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/html-macro-38273085.html] and add block like this: {code} {code}
fields.summary: Can not add data:image as url in Images from the Web under image macro.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33188].
  {panel}

In a Confluence page, I create a link to an anchor inside the same page, using an Advanced link:
* If I type the link text and press Enter rapidly after writing the link text, the created link is only partially correct

Steps to reproduce:
* When editing a Confluence page, click Link icon in the toolbar
* Choose Advanced link type
* In the Link field, type eg. "#ThisIsSomeLinkToAnchor" text and hit Enter rapidly after typing the last letter (r)
* The link gets created. Now open the link (Edit link) and check the link that was created
* The link that was created is "#ThisIsSomeLi", ie. half of the letters got missing

Work-around:
* Wait for a few seconds before hitting Enter when typing a link
fields.summary: Invalid link when creating an advanced link to an anchor with rapid Enter hit

fields.description:
h4. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page
# Add a Widget Connector
# Use a Google Document URL 
# Save the page

h4. Actual Result
Widget Connector does not show anything.

h4. Finding
Widget Connector works well for Google Presentations. 

h4. Workaround (note: does not work with spreadsheets or draw documents)

Create a widget and link to the URL:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SHN5NTEckm6k6cdL92d6KHJjgor0nmOenTAsquCrA5I/edit

This wont work – remove /edit and whatever else, that leaves you with the KEY – add # to the end of the key to become:
https://docs.google.com/document/d/1SHN5NTEckm6k6cdL92d6KHJjgor0nmOenTAsquCrA5I#

This can then be embedded. Removal of # will render it inoperable.
fields.summary: Widget Connector does not work with Google Documents

  {panel}

It should be possible to start editing in dem middle of an article.

Currently the user has a very high interaction impact if the wants to start editing.

Requirement: User has scrolled down to the middle of an article
Steps he must do:
1. Scroll up to top of page
2. Click Edit
3. Scroll down in edit mode to the position he wants to edit (very difficult if a lot of markup is used eg. Panels, Codeblock, Layout)

Better:
1. Hover over the section he wants to edit
  - An edit button will show up (if he has the rights to edit)
2. Click on edit
  - The edit mode opens up at the position clicked before

fields.description:
When I pass search query LONGER THAN 256 characters, search results in empty search page (no results found).
The search query is passed through GET method .../dosearchsite.action?where=TEST&type=page&queryString=...
* POST request method did not help either - behavior is the same.

Example queries - first which is shorter than 256 characters - works fine, second which is longer - doesn't work:

ancestorIds:(29658282 OR 29658159 OR 29658142 OR 29658019 OR 29657896 OR 29657773 OR 29657650 OR 29657527 OR 29657404 OR 29657231 OR 29657090 OR 28543102 OR 28542832 OR 28542603 OR 28542562 OR 28542024 OR 28541754 OR 28541484) AND labelText:"label1"

ancestorIds:(29658405 OR 29658282 OR 29658159 OR 29658142 OR 29658019 OR 29657896 OR 29657773 OR 29657650 OR 29657527 OR 29657404 OR 29657231 OR 29657090 OR 28543102 OR 28542832 OR 28542603 OR 28542562 OR 28542024 OR 28541754 OR 28541484) AND labelText:"label1"

Steps to reproduce:
1. Put together search query that is longer than 256 characters
2. Search Confluence with your query .../dosearchsite.action?where=TEST&type=page&queryString=...

Expected behavior:
found pages (or at least if search is somehow limited inform user about this limit by some kind of warning message...)
!found-results.png!

What happened instead:
No results found
!no-results.png!

Question posted on Atlassian forum:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/267479/is-there-a-length-limitation-of-search-query-in-confluence-5-4-3
fields.summary: No results found when search query is longer than 256 characters

fields.description:
When a tree of pages with links between them is moved from one space to another, some of the links are updated but others are left pointing to the original space. I expect it depends on the order in which the pages are moved. 

To reproduce: 
* create a page A in space 1
* create two child pages A1 and A2 below A
* create a link from A1 to A2 and from A2 to A1
* move page A to space 2
* look at A1 and A2 in space 2 - one of the links will be fine, the other will be broken because it's looking for the page in space 1

This can result in a lot of work required to fix up broken links after moving a tree of pages.
fields.summary: Moving page tree to a new space breaks some links within the tree

fields.description: I tried to create a local Confluence user for someone who has an apostrophe in their name and email address. Many people's surnames contain apostrophes (e.g., "O'Brian") and in many cases people avoid creating email addresses that contain them. However, according to the standard for syntax in email addresses, the local part (the bit before the @ sign) can contain them (see RFC 6531 or http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Email_address). Therefore, I am prevented from creating a user account for a user with an apostrophe.
fields.summary: Valid email addresses containing apostrophes cannot be assigned to a user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33158].
{panel}
As a Confluence user, I need to be able to un-watch specific pages within a watched Space so I can better manage my notifications and relevant content.
h3. Problem Definition

When watching a *Whole Space* (using the option to *Watch This Space*), if I uncheck the *Watch all content in this space* option in a page, *Everything is un-watched* except for the page that I am in at the moment. *This Does Not Happen* with Administrator Users. This affects normal users.
h3. Suggested Resolution

Make the exact opposite behaviour the default one. When unchecking *Watch all content in this space*, keep all pages as *Watching* but allow me to uncheck the ones I need to.
h3. Why this is important

In a space where you have multiple pages, dozens, hundreds of pages but only a few are spamming notifications or are simply not relevant we must be able to simply un-watch those pages if needed. Un-watching the whole space and then having to go after each page and re-watch them is time consuming and counter intuitive.
h3. Workaround
 # Un-watch the Space
 # Un-watch the page where you unchecked *Watch all content in this space*
 # Re-watch all the other pages
fields.summary: Unwatch a page under a watched space

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Login to Confluence with accountOne
# Create a space - "unrestricted"
# Create a space - "restricted", that is accessible only to accountOne
# Create a page in the "unrestricted" space, and add a create from template macro that uses the Space key of restricted
# Logout with accountOne, and login with accountTwo
# Attempt to use this macro

*Expected Results:*
An error message or other form of feedback that the user is attempting to create a page in a restricted space.

*Actual Results:*
The user is sent back to the dashboard, with something like the following in their URL:

{code}http://localhost:10544/confluence/?createDialogSpaceKey=RES&createDialogBlueprintId=a204db16-9209-4242-b84a-8a6448ecf53a{code}
fields.summary: Create From Template macro sends users to dashboard if the space they are creating the macro in doesn't exist

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33156].
  {panel}

Hello,
We have an upload size limit of 5Mb for attachments.
This suits well our politic in file managment.
However, we nedd to put sometimes somes heavy video files for demo, support or new feature.
And in this case, 5Mb is not enough.
We would like to have a specific configuration page to alter the size limit of some specific attachment like mp4,avi.
Would it be possible in future release ?

When a Confluence site host about 200 users, that is not a problem to raise the size limit. But our site hosts about 9000 users. So in this cas, i cannot raise the size limit to 50Mb...
Imagine the speed overload size after some months...
fields.summary: Have Confluence the ability to select some specific file extension to get raised for upload size limit

fields.description:
The EnabledModuleCachingPluginAccessor cache has a 30 minute expiry. We've observed a scenario in CAC where a bunch of items will expire at the same time, and then subsequently all request threads block waiting for these items to be recomputed.

Remove the cache expiry, or implement the Guava refresh() method to asynchronously recompute this stuff in the background.
fields.summary: EnabledModuleCachingPluginAccessor cache shouldn't expire

fields.description:
This one is a little hazy, sorry about that.

A few weeks ago, when CAC was unhealthy, I observed a scenario where a particular page-diff request was running for several (15+) minutes. Unfortunately, because of the bad health of CAC at the time, I was unable to get a heap-dump or determine exactly what URL was requested that lead to this scenario.

What I do know is that the thread was executing for 15+ minutes, and for the entirety of this duration was stuck in org.eclipse.compare.internal.core.LCS. [~don.willis@atlassian.com] has indicated that this should never happen, as page diffs have timeout logic implemented. Is it possible there's some edge-cases, perhaps a page diff that is extremely computationally expensive, that cause the request to exceed its timeout and not be properly interrupted?
fields.summary: Potential page diff edge-case
'depluralisation' makes search poor?
Investigate implications of cache creation all the time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33133].
  {panel}

While page restrictions can be useful in theory, we have found that in reality, giving users permissions to adjust and modify has caused massive headaches. The over-ruling in inheritance on the way down the tree as permissions are adjusted cause an admin headache, and they cause a performance it too in my testing as the checks recurse up or down the tree. Even without the performance concerns, we just don't want that mess.

We have three options at the moment:
 - allow users to do what they want and have a mess
 - only allow admins access to manage restrictions (with 2000 users, this causes a hefty overhead on the human side)
 - disable permissions site-wide and require varying ACL requests to happen at a space level

We have currently opted for the third option as this is the best out of those 3, at least for us.

An ideal fourth option though, would be if we could limit page restrictions just so they can be managed at the first level of pages within a space. This would stop the overwriting inheritance issue and the permissions. Some people may like this to happen for the first 2 levels, some deeper, so a droplist of 1-xx depth limit on this setting would give more flexibility.
fields.summary: Limit depth that page restrictions can be added at

fields.description:
If you create a page adding two column macros and click in save, they will display next to each other:
!img.PNG|thumbnail!
But once you use the "Export to PDF" function those columns will display once after the other instead of being side by side:
!img2.PNG|thumbnail!

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a page.
# Add two column macros, one after the other.
# Fill the columns with any content, like below example:
{code}
iusdhflfkdsfhflidsfhflshftetur adipiscing elit. Etiam dui mi, lacinia quis ante vel, feugiat vulputate ipsum. Morbi ac facilisis velit. Nunc venenatis, massa ac porttitor ultricies, diam massa pharetra tortor, sed ultricies nisi justo lacinia nulla. Sed volutpat libero vitae augue cursus accumsan
{code}
# Save it.
# Observer the columns are next to each other.
# Now click in Tools > Export to PDF.
# Observer that the columns that were side by side in step 5 are now one under the other.

h4 Work Around:

One workaround for this behaviour is to create a table of 1 line and 2 columns, then add your column macro inside it, if you export to PDF doing like this, you will see that the columns will be side by side.
In the Confluence Page
!img3.PNG|thumbnail!
After Exporting to PDF:
!img4.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Columns are displayed incorrectly in PDF export.

fields.description:
If you create a Custom HTML macro, like a drop down with multiple options, it will work fine in the Confluence page:
!img.PNG|thumbnail!
However if you use the "Export to PDF" function it will show you all the drop down options instead of the selected one:
!img2.PNG|thumbnail!

Steps to reproduce:
# Go to Confluence Admin > Manage Add-ons.
# Enable all the modules of the Confluence HTML system plugin.
# Create a page with a Custom HTML macro with below code:
{code}
<select>
<option value="1a">Option A</option>
<option value="2a">Option B</option>
<option value="3a">Option C</option>
<option value="4a">Option D</option>
</select>
{code}
# Save it.
# Now Click in Tools > "Export to PDF".
# You will see that all the options will show up in the pdf export instead the selected or the first one.
fields.summary: Custom Html Macro is showing all options in PDF export instead the selected one.

fields.description:
Not sure if this would be considered an improvement or a bug. When retrieving attachment info from the prototype rest api. (i.e. {{/rest/prototype/1/attachment}}), there isn't a field that indicates the user who uploaded the attachment. There is an "owner" field but this refers to the content the attachment is attached to. This seems like a major oversight since this field does exist in the old remote api (json-rpc, xml-rpc, soap). 

You would probably say "oh, easy, just use the old remote api". The problem is that I have an attachment ID but the old api uses filename and page id to look up attachment. Therefore, to get the username of the attachment uploader, I need to currently make 2 requests. First, to the prototype api to get the information to make a request to the old remote api. Then to the old remote api.
fields.summary: No way to determine attachment creator via REST api

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33120].
  {panel}

When we searching in German, search result are often empty. Not because of the search term in not present but because the way the tokenizer splits words.

For example :
I have a page named Spülmaschine (dishwasher). Unfortunately Confluence does not find the word "Spühlmaschine" (dishwasher) when I search for "maschine" (washer).

There is a very interesting article about this online which is very useful for improving our current search function.

http://engineering.wayfair.com/improving-german-solrlucene-search-results/
fields.summary: improving german solrlucene search results

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33119].
  {panel}

Confluence will add me to the page restrictions when I change the edit restrictions of a page. It will do so no matter if I have created or ever edit the page. 
I know that the documentation says:

You cannot exclude yourself
As creator or editor of a page, you cannot use page restrictions to deny yourself access to the page. Confluence will automatically add your username into the list of users/groups allowed to view/edit the page. If you remove your username, Confluence will put it back again. 

But that does not make sense for my use case: As an admin I sometimes want to restrict pages for other people but I do not want my user to be added to those pages. 

Please make it possible to remove the own user from the page restrictions. 

Thanks Liesa
fields.summary: Removing oneself from page restrictions

I used Atlassian Confluence on Demand (renasar.atlassian.net), and was attempting to edit pages with my iPad through the browser (both Safari and Chrome).

I had switched to the "Desktop view" since that seemed to be the only way to get to actually editing/updating a page in our wiki.

I had offline notes that I wanted to consolidate into our Wiki, and was completely unable to "paste" in the notes to an editing field.

Additionally, the responsiveness of directly editing in the browser was terrible - there was a noticable pause between keypress and letter showing up, while editing, causing the editing experience to be entirely suboptimal, plus I really didn't want to re-type all that content.
fields.summary: iPad editing support - safari/chrome

fields.description:
If you have a file with the extension on all upper case letters, clicking in the "edit in office" will not work at all.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a page and add two attachments.
# Add two attachments in there:
!img.PNG|thumbnail!
# Click in "edit in office" for the DOC2.DOC.
# Nothing will happen.

Note: This is not reproducible in IE and it was tested against the latest version of Fire Fox (28).

h4. Expected behaviour:
The file should open normally as the second file, doc.doc.

h4. Work Around
Change the file extension from upper case (DOC) to lower (doc).
fields.summary: Edit in office doesn't open attachments when the file extention is entirely on Uppercase if you are using FireFox.
